1.text: Bring approximately 4 cups (1L) of water to the boil.

2.text: Pour the boiled water into the teapot.

3.text: Let the water reach 96 °C (205 °F) if you are making black tea.

4.text: Wait for 2-3 minutes so the water reaches 71–82 °C (160–180 °F) for green tea.

5.text: Check the amount of time that your tea requires to steep.

6.text: Place tea bags into the teapot if you are short on time.

7.text: Remove the tea bags from the teapot after the alloted steeping time.

8.text: Use loose leaf tea instead of tea bags for a better flavored tea.

9.text: Serve English tea during the traditional 3-4 pm tea time.

10.text: Use porcelain, ceramic, or glass cups to serve the tea.

11.text: Pour the tea from the teapot into individual cups.

12.text: Add milk to black tea if preferred.

13.text: Place 1-2 teaspoons of white sugar into black tea if you prefer.

14.text: Stir your tea carefully if you have added milk or sugar.

15.text: Enjoy tea served with light foods.
